    7042      122808 :     memset(decdigits + i, 0, DEC_DIGITS - 1);
    7043             : 
    7044             :     /* Handle exponent, if any */
    7045      122808 :     if (*cp == 'e' || *cp == 'E')
    7046             :     {
    7047        1050 :         int64       exponent = 0;
    7048        1050 :         bool        neg = false;
    7049             : 
    7050             :         /*
    7051             :          * At this point, dweight and dscale can't be more than about
    7052             :          * INT_MAX/2 due to the MaxAllocSize limit on string length, so
    7053             :          * constraining the exponent similarly should be enough to prevent
    7054             :          * integer overflow in this function.  If the value is too large to
    7055             :          * fit in storage format, make_result() will complain about it later;
    7056             :          * for consistency use the same ereport errcode/text as make_result().
    7057             :          */
    7058             : 
    7059             :         /* exponent sign */
    7060        1050 :         cp++;
    7061        1050 :         if (*cp == '+')
    7062         154 :             cp++;
    7063         896 :         else if (*cp == '-')
    7064             :         {
    7065         380 :             neg = true;
    7066         380 :             cp++;
    7067             :         }
    7068             : 
    7069             :         /* exponent digits */
    7070        1050 :         if (!isdigit((unsigned char) *cp))
    7071           6 :             goto invalid_syntax;
    7072             : 
    7073        3252 :         while (*cp)
    7074             :         {
    7075        2226 :             if (isdigit((unsigned char) *cp))
    7076             :             {
    7077        2184 :                 exponent = exponent * 10 + (*cp++ - '0');
    7078        2184 :                 if (exponent > PG_INT32_MAX / 2)
    7079           6 :                     goto out_of_range;
    7080             :             }
    7081          42 :             else if (*cp == '_')
    7082             :             {
    7083             :                 /* underscore must be followed by more digits */
    7084          42 :                 cp++;
    7085          42 :                 if (!isdigit((unsigned char) *cp))
    7086          12 :                     goto invalid_syntax;
    7087             :             }
    7088             :             else
    7089           0 :                 break;
    7090             :         }
    7091             : 
    7092        1026 :         if (neg)
    7093         380 :             exponent = -exponent;
    7094             : 
    7095        1026 :         dweight += (int) exponent;
    7096        1026 :         dscale -= (int) exponent;
    7097        1026 :         if (dscale < 0)
    7098         442 :             dscale = 0;
    7099             :     }
    7100             : 
    7101             :     /*
    7102             :      * Okay, convert pure-decimal representation to base NBASE.  First we need
    7103             :      * to determine the converted weight and ndigits.  offset is the number of
    7104             :      * decimal zeroes to insert before the first given digit to have a
    7105             :      * correctly aligned first NBASE digit.
    7106             :      */
    7107      122784 :     if (dweight >= 0)
    7108      122124 :         weight = (dweight + 1 + DEC_DIGITS - 1) / DEC_DIGITS - 1;
    7109             :     else
    7110         660 :         weight = -((-dweight - 1) / DEC_DIGITS + 1);
    7111      122784 :     offset = (weight + 1) * DEC_DIGITS - (dweight + 1);
    7112      122784 :     ndigits = (ddigits + offset + DEC_DIGITS - 1) / DEC_DIGITS;
    7113             : 
    7114      122784 :     alloc_var(dest, ndigits);
    7115      122784 :     dest->sign = sign;
    7116      122784 :     dest->weight = weight;
    7117      122784 :     dest->dscale = dscale;
    7118             : 
    7119      122784 :     i = DEC_DIGITS - offset;
    7120      122784 :     digits = dest->digits;
    7121             : 
    7122      288632 :     while (ndigits-- > 0)
    7123             :     {
    7124             : #if DEC_DIGITS == 4
    7125      165848 :         *digits++ = ((decdigits[i] * 10 + decdigits[i + 1]) * 10 +
    7126      165848 :                      decdigits[i + 2]) * 10 + decdigits[i + 3];
    7127             : #elif DEC_DIGITS == 2
    7128             :         *digits++ = decdigits[i] * 10 + decdigits[i + 1];
    7129             : #elif DEC_DIGITS == 1
    7130             :         *digits++ = decdigits[i];
    7131             : #else
    7132             : #error unsupported NBASE
    7133             : #endif
    7134      165848 :         i += DEC_DIGITS;
    7135             :     }
    7136             : 
    7137      122784 :     pfree(decdigits);
    7138             : 
    7139             :     /* Strip any leading/trailing zeroes, and normalize weight if zero */
    7140      122784 :     strip_var(dest);
    7141             : 
    7142             :     /* Return end+1 position for caller */
    7143      122784 :     *endptr = cp;
    7144             : 
    7145      122784 :     return true;
    7146             : 
    7147           6 : out_of_range:
    7148           6 :     ereturn(escontext, false,
    7149             :             (errcode(ERRCODE_NUMERIC_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE),
    7150             :              errmsg("value overflows numeric format")));
    7151             : 
    7152          42 : invalid_syntax:

    7158             : 
    7159             : 
    7160             : /*
    7161             :  * Return the numeric value of a single hex digit.
    7162             :  */
    7163             : static inline int
    7164         708 : xdigit_value(char dig)
    7165             : {
    7166         894 :     return dig >= '0' && dig <= '9' ? dig - '0' :
    7167         294 :         dig >= 'a' && dig <= 'f' ? dig - 'a' + 10 :
    7168         108 :         dig >= 'A' && dig <= 'F' ? dig - 'A' + 10 : -1;
    7169             : }
    7170             : 
    7171             : /*
    7172             :  * set_var_from_non_decimal_integer_str()
    7173             :  *
    7174             :  *  Parse a string containing a non-decimal integer
    7175             :  *
    7176             :  * This function does not handle leading or trailing spaces.  It returns
    7177             :  * the end+1 position parsed into *endptr, so that caller can check for
    7178             :  * trailing spaces/garbage if deemed necessary.
    7179             :  *
    7180             :  * cp is the place to actually start parsing; str is what to use in error
    7181             :  * reports.  The number's sign and base prefix indicator (e.g., "0x") are
    7182             :  * assumed to have already been parsed, so cp should point to the number's
    7183             :  * first digit in the base specified.
    7184             :  *
    7185             :  * base is expected to be 2, 8 or 16.
    7186             :  *
    7187             :  * Returns true on success, false on failure (if escontext points to an
    7188             :  * ErrorSaveContext; otherwise errors are thrown).
    7189             :  */
    7190             : static bool
    7191         156 : set_var_from_non_decimal_integer_str(const char *str, const char *cp, int sign,
    7192             :                                      int base, NumericVar *dest,
    7193             :                                      const char **endptr, Node *escontext)
    7194             : {
    7195         156 :     const char *firstdigit = cp;
    7196             :     int64       tmp;
    7197             :     int64       mul;
    7198             :     NumericVar  tmp_var;
    7199             : 
    7200         156 :     init_var(&tmp_var);
    7201             : 
    7202         156 :     zero_var(dest);
    7203             : 
    7204             :     /*
    7205             :      * Process input digits in groups that fit in int64.  Here "tmp" is the
    7206             :      * value of the digits in the group, and "mul" is base^n, where n is the
    7207             :      * number of digits in the group.  Thus tmp < mul, and we must start a new
    7208             :      * group when mul * base threatens to overflow PG_INT64_MAX.
    7209             :      */
    7210         156 :     tmp = 0;
    7211         156 :     mul = 1;
    7212             : 
    7213         156 :     if (base == 16)
    7214             :     {
    7215         828 :         while (*cp)
    7216             :         {
    7217         798 :             if (isxdigit((unsigned char) *cp))
    7218             :             {
    7219         708 :                 if (mul > PG_INT64_MAX / 16)
    7220             :                 {
    7221             :                     /* Add the contribution from this group of digits */
    7222          30 :                     int64_to_numericvar(mul, &tmp_var);
    7223          30 :                     mul_var(dest, &tmp_var, dest, 0);
    7224          30 :                     int64_to_numericvar(tmp, &tmp_var);
    7225          30 :                     add_var(dest, &tmp_var, dest);
    7226             : 
    7227             :                     /* Result will overflow if weight overflows int16 */
    7228          30 :                     if (dest->weight > SHRT_MAX)
    7229           0 :                         goto out_of_range;
    7230             : 
    7231             :                     /* Begin a new group */
    7232          30 :                     tmp = 0;
    7233          30 :                     mul = 1;
    7234             :                 }
    7235             : 
    7236         708 :                 tmp = tmp * 16 + xdigit_value(*cp++);
    7237         708 :                 mul = mul * 16;
    7238             :             }
    7239          90 :             else if (*cp == '_')
    7240             :             {
    7241             :                 /* Underscore must be followed by more digits */
    7242          66 :                 cp++;
    7243          66 :                 if (!isxdigit((unsigned char) *cp))
    7244          18 :                     goto invalid_syntax;
    7245             :             }
    7246             :             else
    7247          24 :                 break;
    7248             :         }
    7249             :     }
    7250          84 :     else if (base == 8)
    7251             :     {
    7252         636 :         while (*cp)
    7253             :         {
    7254         606 :             if (*cp >= '0' && *cp <= '7')
    7255             :             {
    7256         558 :                 if (mul > PG_INT64_MAX / 8)
    7257             :                 {

    7264             :                     /* Result will overflow if weight overflows int16 */
    7265          18 :                     if (dest->weight > SHRT_MAX)
    7266           0 :                         goto out_of_range;
    7267             : 
    7268             :                     /* Begin a new group */

    7270          18 :                     mul = 1;
    7271             :                 }
    7272             : 
    7273         558 :                 tmp = tmp * 8 + (*cp++ - '0');

    7277             :             {
    7278             :                 /* Underscore must be followed by more digits */

    7281           0 :                     goto invalid_syntax;

    7298          18 :                     int64_to_numericvar(tmp, &tmp_var);
    7299          18 :                     add_var(dest, &tmp_var, dest);
    7300             : 
    7301             :                     /* Result will overflow if weight overflows int16 */
    7302          18 :                     if (dest->weight > SHRT_MAX)
    7303           0 :                         goto out_of_range;
    7304             : 
    7305             :                     /* Begin a new group */
    7306          18 :                     tmp = 0;
    7307          18 :                     mul = 1;
    7308             :                 }
    7309             : 
    7310        1416 :                 tmp = tmp * 2 + (*cp++ - '0');

    7353             :              errmsg("value overflows numeric format")));
    7354             : 
    7355          18 : invalid_syntax:
    7356          18 :     ereturn(escontext, false,
    7357             :             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TEXT_REPRESENTATION),
    7358             :              errmsg("invalid input syntax for type %s: \"%s\"",
    7359             :                     "numeric", str)));

    7362             : 
    7363             : /*
    7364             :  * set_var_from_num() -
    7365             :  *
    7366             :  *  Convert the packed db format into a variable
    7367             :  */
    7368             : static void
    7369       12374 : set_var_from_num(Numeric num, NumericVar *dest)
    7370             : {
    7371             :     int         ndigits;
    7372             : 
    7373       12374 :     ndigits = NUMERIC_NDIGITS(num);
    7374             : 
    7375       12374 :     alloc_var(dest, ndigits);
    7376             : 
    7377       12374 :     dest->weight = NUMERIC_WEIGHT(num);
    7378       12374 :     dest->sign = NUMERIC_SIGN(num);
    7379       12374 :     dest->dscale = NUMERIC_DSCALE(num);
    7380             : 
    7381       12374 :     memcpy(dest->digits, NUMERIC_DIGITS(num), ndigits * sizeof(NumericDigit));
    7382       12374 : }
    7383             : 
    7384             : 
    7385             : /*
    7386             :  * init_var_from_num() -
    7387             :  *
    7388             :  *  Initialize a variable from packed db format. The digits array is not
    7389             :  *  copied, which saves some cycles when the resulting var is not modified.
    7390             :  *  Also, there's no need to call free_var(), as long as you don't assign any
    7391             :  *  other value to it (with set_var_* functions, or by using the var as the
    7392             :  *  destination of a function like add_var())
    7393             :  *
    7394             :  *  CAUTION: Do not modify the digits buffer of a var initialized with this
    7395             :  *  function, e.g by calling round_var() or trunc_var(), as the changes will
    7396             :  *  propagate to the original Numeric! It's OK to use it as the destination
    7397             :  *  argument of one of the calculational functions, though.
    7398             :  */
    7399             : static void
    7400     4876626 : init_var_from_num(Numeric num, NumericVar *dest)
    7401             : {
    7402     4876626 :     dest->ndigits = NUMERIC_NDIGITS(num);
    7403     4876626 :     dest->weight = NUMERIC_WEIGHT(num);
    7404     4876626 :     dest->sign = NUMERIC_SIGN(num);
    7405     4876626 :     dest->dscale = NUMERIC_DSCALE(num);
    7406     4876626 :     dest->digits = NUMERIC_DIGITS(num);
    7407     4876626 :     dest->buf = NULL;            /* digits array is not palloc'd */
    7408     4876626 : }
    7409             : 
    7410             : 
    7411             : /*
    7412             :  * set_var_from_var() -
    7413             :  *
    7414             :  *  Copy one variable into another
    7415             :  */

    7443      795014 : get_str_from_var(const NumericVar *var)

    7453             : #if DEC_DIGITS > 1
    7454             :     NumericDigit d1;
    7455             : #endif

    7457      795014 :     dscale = var->dscale;
    7458             : 
    7459             :     /*
    7460             :      * Allocate space for the result.
    7461             :      *
    7462             :      * i is set to the # of decimal digits before decimal point. dscale is the
    7463             :      * # of decimal digits we will print after decimal point. We may generate
    7464             :      * as many as DEC_DIGITS-1 excess digits at the end, and in addition we
    7465             :      * need room for sign, decimal point, null terminator.
    7466             :      */

    7468      795014 :     if (i <= 0)
    7469      139846 :         i = 1;

    7471      795014 :     str = palloc(i + dscale + DEC_DIGITS + 2);
    7472      795014 :     cp = str;
    7473             : 
    7474             :     /*
    7475             :      * Output a dash for negative values
    7476             :      */

    7478        4892 :         *cp++ = '-';
    7479             : 
    7480             :     /*
    7481             :      * Output all digits before the decimal point
    7482             :      */

    7572             : 
    7573             : /*
    7574             :  * get_str_from_var_sci() -
    7575             :  *
    7576             :  *  Convert a var to a normalised scientific notation text representation.
    7577             :  *  This function does the heavy lifting for numeric_out_sci().
    7578             :  *
    7579             :  *  This notation has the general form a * 10^b, where a is known as the
    7580             :  *  "significand" and b is known as the "exponent".
    7581             :  *
    7582             :  *  Because we can't do superscript in ASCII (and because we want to copy
    7583             :  *  printf's behaviour) we display the exponent using E notation, with a
    7584             :  *  minimum of two exponent digits.
    7585             :  *
    7586             :  *  For example, the value 1234 could be output as 1.2e+03.
    7587             :  *
    7588             :  *  We assume that the exponent can fit into an int32.
    7589             :  *
    7590             :  *  rscale is the number of decimal digits desired after the decimal point in
    7591             :  *  the output, negative values will be treated as meaning zero.
    7592             :  *
    7593             :  *  Returns a palloc'd string.
    7594             :  */
    7595             : static char *
    7596         216 : get_str_from_var_sci(const NumericVar *var, int rscale)
    7597             : {
    7598             :     int32       exponent;
    7599             :     NumericVar  tmp_var;
    7600             :     size_t      len;
    7601             :     char       *str;
    7602             :     char       *sig_out;
    7603             : 
    7604         216 :     if (rscale < 0)
    7605           0 :         rscale = 0;
    7606             : 
    7607             :     /*
    7608             :      * Determine the exponent of this number in normalised form.
    7609             :      *
    7610             :      * This is the exponent required to represent the number with only one
    7611             :      * significant digit before the decimal place.
    7612             :      */
    7613         216 :     if (var->ndigits > 0)
    7614             :     {
    7615         198 :         exponent = (var->weight + 1) * DEC_DIGITS;
    7616             : 
    7617             :         /*
    7618             :          * Compensate for leading decimal zeroes in the first numeric digit by
    7619             :          * decrementing the exponent.
    7620             :          */
    7621         198 :         exponent -= DEC_DIGITS - (int) log10(var->digits[0]);
    7622             :     }
    7623             :     else
    7624             :     {
    7625             :         /*
    7626             :          * If var has no digits, then it must be zero.
    7627             :          *
    7628             :          * Zero doesn't technically have a meaningful exponent in normalised
    7629             :          * notation, but we just display the exponent as zero for consistency
    7630             :          * of output.
    7631             :          */
    7632          18 :         exponent = 0;
    7633             :     }
    7634             : 
    7635             :     /*
    7636             :      * Divide var by 10^exponent to get the significand, rounding to rscale
    7637             :      * decimal digits in the process.
    7638             :      */
    7639         216 :     init_var(&tmp_var);
    7640             : 
    7641         216 :     power_ten_int(exponent, &tmp_var);
    7642         216 :     div_var(var, &tmp_var, &tmp_var, rscale, true);
    7643         216 :     sig_out = get_str_from_var(&tmp_var);
    7644             : 
    7645         216 :     free_var(&tmp_var);
    7646             : 
    7647             :     /*
    7648             :      * Allocate space for the result.
    7649             :      *
    7650             :      * In addition to the significand, we need room for the exponent
    7651             :      * decoration ("e"), the sign of the exponent, up to 10 digits for the
    7652             :      * exponent itself, and of course the null terminator.
    7653             :      */
    7654         216 :     len = strlen(sig_out) + 13;
    7655         216 :     str = palloc(len);
    7656         216 :     snprintf(str, len, "%se%+03d", sig_out, exponent);
    7657             : 
    7658         216 :     pfree(sig_out);
    7659             : 
    7660         216 :     return str;
    7661             : }
    7662             : 
    7663             : 
    7664             : /*
    7665             :  * numericvar_serialize - serialize NumericVar to binary format
    7666             :  *
    7667             :  * At variable level, no checks are performed on the weight or dscale, allowing
    7668             :  * us to pass around intermediate values with higher precision than supported
    7669             :  * by the numeric type.  Note: this is incompatible with numeric_send/recv(),
    7670             :  * which use 16-bit integers for these fields.
    7671             :  */

    7721             : /*
    7722             :  * make_result_opt_error() -

    7844             : 
    7845             : 
    7846             : /*
    7847             :  * apply_typmod() -
    7848             :  *
    7849             :  *  Do bounds checking and rounding according to the specified typmod.
    7850             :  *  Note that this is only applied to normal finite values.
    7851             :  *
    7852             :  * Returns true on success, false on failure (if escontext points to an
    7853             :  * ErrorSaveContext; otherwise errors are thrown).
    7854             :  */
    7855             : static bool
    7856      104842 : apply_typmod(NumericVar *var, int32 typmod, Node *escontext)
    7857             : {
    7858             :     int         precision;
    7859             :     int         scale;
    7860             :     int         maxdigits;
    7861             :     int         ddigits;
    7862             :     int         i;
    7863             : 
    7864             :     /* Do nothing if we have an invalid typmod */
    7865      104842 :     if (!is_valid_numeric_typmod(typmod))
    7866      100170 :         return true;
    7867             : 
    7868        4672 :     precision = numeric_typmod_precision(typmod);
    7869        4672 :     scale = numeric_typmod_scale(typmod);
    7870        4672 :     maxdigits = precision - scale;
    7871             : 
    7872             :     /* Round to target scale (and set var->dscale) */
    7873        4672 :     round_var(var, scale);
    7874             : 
    7875             :     /* but don't allow var->dscale to be negative */
    7876        4672 :     if (var->dscale < 0)
    7877         126 :         var->dscale = 0;
    7878             : 
    7879             :     /*
    7880             :      * Check for overflow - note we can't do this before rounding, because
    7881             :      * rounding could raise the weight.  Also note that the var's weight could
    7882             :      * be inflated by leading zeroes, which will be stripped before storage
    7883             :      * but perhaps might not have been yet. In any case, we must recognize a
    7884             :      * true zero, whose weight doesn't mean anything.
    7885             :      */
    7886        4672 :     ddigits = (var->weight + 1) * DEC_DIGITS;
    7887        4672 :     if (ddigits > maxdigits)
    7888             :     {
    7889             :         /* Determine true weight; and check for all-zero result */
    7890         382 :         for (i = 0; i < var->ndigits; i++)
    7891             :         {
    7892         368 :             NumericDigit dig = var->digits[i];
    7893             : 
    7894         368 :             if (dig)
    7895             :             {
    7896             :                 /* Adjust for any high-order decimal zero digits */

    7931             : /*
    7932             :  * apply_typmod_special() -
    7933             :  *
    7934             :  *  Do bounds checking according to the specified typmod, for an Inf or NaN.
    7935             :  *  For convenience of most callers, the value is presented in packed form.
    7936             :  *
    7937             :  * Returns true on success, false on failure (if escontext points to an
    7938             :  * ErrorSaveContext; otherwise errors are thrown).

    7954        1748 :     if (NUMERIC_IS_NAN(num))

    8373             : /*

    8380      463970 : add_var(const NumericVar *var1, const NumericVar *var2, NumericVar *result)
    8381             : {
    8382             :     /*
    8383             :      * Decide on the signs of the two variables what to do
    8384             :      */
    8385      463970 :     if (var1->sign == NUMERIC_POS)
    8386             :     {
    8387      462404 :         if (var2->sign == NUMERIC_POS)
    8388             :         {
    8389             :             /*
    8390             :              * Both are positive result = +(ABS(var1) + ABS(var2))
    8391             :              */

    8393      289298 :             result->sign = NUMERIC_POS;
    8394             :         }
    8395             :         else
    8396             :         {
    8397             :             /*
    8398             :              * var1 is positive, var2 is negative Must compare absolute values
    8399             :              */
    8400      173106 :             switch (cmp_abs(var1, var2))
    8401             :             {
    8402          32 :                 case 0:
    8403             :                     /* ----------
    8404             :                      * ABS(var1) == ABS(var2)
    8405             :                      * result = ZERO
    8406             :                      * ----------
    8407             :                      */
    8408          32 :                     zero_var(result);
    8409          32 :                     result->dscale = Max(var1->dscale, var2->dscale);
    8410          32 :                     break;
    8411             : 
    8412      172786 :                 case 1:
    8413             :                     /* ----------
    8414             :                      * ABS(var1) > ABS(var2)
    8415             :                      * result = +(ABS(var1) - ABS(var2))
    8416             :                      * ----------
    8417             :                      */
    8418      172786 :                     sub_abs(var1, var2, result);
    8419      172786 :                     result->sign = NUMERIC_POS;
    8420      172786 :                     break;

    8422         288 :                 case -1:

    8424             :                      * ABS(var1) < ABS(var2)

    8426             :                      * ----------

    8429         288 :                     result->sign = NUMERIC_NEG;
    8430         288 :                     break;

    8437             :         {

    8462         294 :                     result->sign = NUMERIC_NEG;
    8463         294 :                     break;
    8464             : 
    8465         144 :                 case -1:
    8466             :                     /* ----------
    8467             :                      * ABS(var1) < ABS(var2)
    8468             :                      * result = +(ABS(var2) - ABS(var1))
    8469             :                      * ----------
    8470             :                      */
    8471         144 :                     sub_abs(var2, var1, result);
    8472         144 :                     result->sign = NUMERIC_POS;
    8473         144 :                     break;
    8474             :             }
    8475             :         }
    8476             :         else
    8477             :         {
    8478             :             /* ----------
    8479             :              * Both are negative
    8480             :              * result = -(ABS(var1) + ABS(var2))
    8481             :              * ----------
    8482             :              */
    8483        1098 :             add_abs(var1, var2, result);

    8490             : /*

    8610             : 
    8611             : /*
    8612             :  * mul_var() -
    8613             :  *
    8614             :  *  Multiplication on variable level. Product of var1 * var2 is stored
    8615             :  *  in result.  Result is rounded to no more than rscale fractional digits.
    8616             :  */
    8617             : static void
    8618      829546 : mul_var(const NumericVar *var1, const NumericVar *var2, NumericVar *result,
    8619             :         int rscale)
    8620             : {
    8621             :     int         res_ndigits;
    8622             :     int         res_sign;
    8623             :     int         res_weight;
    8624             :     int         maxdigits;
    8625             :     int        *dig;
    8626             :     int         carry;
    8627             :     int         maxdig;
    8628             :     int         newdig;
    8629             :     int         var1ndigits;
    8630             :     int         var2ndigits;
    8631             :     NumericDigit *var1digits;
    8632             :     NumericDigit *var2digits;
    8633             :     NumericDigit *res_digits;
    8634             :     int         i,
    8635             :                 i1,
    8636             :                 i2;
    8637             : 
    8638             :     /*
    8639             :      * Arrange for var1 to be the shorter of the two numbers.  This improves
    8640             :      * performance because the inner multiplication loop is much simpler than
    8641             :      * the outer loop, so it's better to have a smaller number of iterations
    8642             :      * of the outer loop.  This also reduces the number of times that the
    8643             :      * accumulator array needs to be normalized.
    8644             :      */
    8645      829546 :     if (var1->ndigits > var2->ndigits)
    8646             :     {
    8647       14848 :         const NumericVar *tmp = var1;
    8648             : 
    8649       14848 :         var1 = var2;
    8650       14848 :         var2 = tmp;
    8651             :     }
    8652             : 
    8653             :     /* copy these values into local vars for speed in inner loop */
    8654      829546 :     var1ndigits = var1->ndigits;
    8655      829546 :     var2ndigits = var2->ndigits;
    8656      829546 :     var1digits = var1->digits;
    8657      829546 :     var2digits = var2->digits;
    8658             : 
    8659      829546 :     if (var1ndigits == 0 || var2ndigits == 0)
    8660             :     {
    8661             :         /* one or both inputs is zero; so is result */
    8662        1712 :         zero_var(result);
    8663        1712 :         result->dscale = rscale;
    8664        1712 :         return;
    8665             :     }
    8666             : 
    8667             :     /* Determine result sign and (maximum possible) weight */
    8668      827834 :     if (var1->sign == var2->sign)
    8669      825304 :         res_sign = NUMERIC_POS;
    8670             :     else
    8671        2530 :         res_sign = NUMERIC_NEG;
    8672      827834 :     res_weight = var1->weight + var2->weight + 2;
    8673             : 
    8674             :     /*
    8675             :      * Determine the number of result digits to compute.  If the exact result
    8676             :      * would have more than rscale fractional digits, truncate the computation
    8677             :      * with MUL_GUARD_DIGITS guard digits, i.e., ignore input digits that
    8678             :      * would only contribute to the right of that.  (This will give the exact
    8679             :      * rounded-to-rscale answer unless carries out of the ignored positions
    8680             :      * would have propagated through more than MUL_GUARD_DIGITS digits.)
    8681             :      *
    8682             :      * Note: an exact computation could not produce more than var1ndigits +
    8683             :      * var2ndigits digits, but we allocate one extra output digit in case
    8684             :      * rscale-driven rounding produces a carry out of the highest exact digit.
    8685             :      */
    8686      827834 :     res_ndigits = var1ndigits + var2ndigits + 1;
    8687      827834 :     maxdigits = res_weight + 1 + (rscale + DEC_DIGITS - 1) / DEC_DIGITS +
    8688             :         MUL_GUARD_DIGITS;
    8689      827834 :     res_ndigits = Min(res_ndigits, maxdigits);
    8690             : 
    8691      827834 :     if (res_ndigits < 3)
    8692             :     {
    8693             :         /* All input digits will be ignored; so result is zero */
    8694          12 :         zero_var(result);
    8695          12 :         result->dscale = rscale;
    8696          12 :         return;
    8697             :     }
    8698             : 
    8699             :     /*
    8700             :      * We do the arithmetic in an array "dig[]" of signed int's.  Since
    8701             :      * INT_MAX is noticeably larger than NBASE*NBASE, this gives us headroom
    8702             :      * to avoid normalizing carries immediately.
    8703             :      *
    8704             :      * maxdig tracks the maximum possible value of any dig[] entry; when this
    8705             :      * threatens to exceed INT_MAX, we take the time to propagate carries.
    8706             :      * Furthermore, we need to ensure that overflow doesn't occur during the
    8707             :      * carry propagation passes either.  The carry values could be as much as
    8708             :      * INT_MAX/NBASE, so really we must normalize when digits threaten to
    8709             :      * exceed INT_MAX - INT_MAX/NBASE.
    8710             :      *
    8711             :      * To avoid overflow in maxdig itself, it actually represents the max
    8712             :      * possible value divided by NBASE-1, ie, at the top of the loop it is
    8713             :      * known that no dig[] entry exceeds maxdig * (NBASE-1).
    8714             :      */
    8715      827822 :     dig = (int *) palloc0(res_ndigits * sizeof(int));
    8716      827822 :     maxdig = 0;
    8717             : 
    8718             :     /*
    8719             :      * The least significant digits of var1 should be ignored if they don't
    8720             :      * contribute directly to the first res_ndigits digits of the result that
    8721             :      * we are computing.
    8722             :      *
    8723             :      * Digit i1 of var1 and digit i2 of var2 are multiplied and added to digit
    8724             :      * i1+i2+2 of the accumulator array, so we need only consider digits of
    8725             :      * var1 for which i1 <= res_ndigits - 3.
    8726             :      */
    8727     4631512 :     for (i1 = Min(var1ndigits - 1, res_ndigits - 3); i1 >= 0; i1--)
    8728             :     {
    8729     3803690 :         NumericDigit var1digit = var1digits[i1];
    8730             : 
    8731     3803690 :         if (var1digit == 0)
    8732     2359440 :             continue;
    8733             : 
    8734             :         /* Time to normalize? */
    8735     1444250 :         maxdig += var1digit;
    8736     1444250 :         if (maxdig > (INT_MAX - INT_MAX / NBASE) / (NBASE - 1))
    8737             :         {
    8738             :             /* Yes, do it */
    8739        9144 :             carry = 0;
    8740    45810696 :             for (i = res_ndigits - 1; i >= 0; i--)
    8741             :             {
    8742    45801552 :                 newdig = dig[i] + carry;
    8743    45801552 :                 if (newdig >= NBASE)
    8744             :                 {
    8745    23065602 :                     carry = newdig / NBASE;
    8746    23065602 :                     newdig -= carry * NBASE;
    8747             :                 }
    8748             :                 else
    8749    22735950 :                     carry = 0;
    8750    45801552 :                 dig[i] = newdig;
    8751             :             }
    8752        9144 :             Assert(carry == 0);
    8753             :             /* Reset maxdig to indicate new worst-case */
    8754        9144 :             maxdig = 1 + var1digit;
    8755             :         }
    8756             : 
    8757             :         /*
    8758             :          * Add the appropriate multiple of var2 into the accumulator.
    8759             :          *
    8760             :          * As above, digits of var2 can be ignored if they don't contribute,
    8761             :          * so we only include digits for which i1+i2+2 < res_ndigits.
    8762             :          *
    8763             :          * This inner loop is the performance bottleneck for multiplication,
    8764             :          * so we want to keep it simple enough so that it can be
    8765             :          * auto-vectorized.  Accordingly, process the digits left-to-right
    8766             :          * even though schoolbook multiplication would suggest right-to-left.
    8767             :          * Since we aren't propagating carries in this loop, the order does
    8768             :          * not matter.
    8769             :          */
    8770             :         {
    8771     1444250 :             int         i2limit = Min(var2ndigits, res_ndigits - i1 - 2);
    8772     1444250 :             int        *dig_i1_2 = &dig[i1 + 2];
    8773             : 
    8774   499116178 :             for (i2 = 0; i2 < i2limit; i2++)
    8775   497671928 :                 dig_i1_2[i2] += var1digit * var2digits[i2];
    8776             :         }
    8777             :     }
    8778             : 
    8779             :     /*
    8780             :      * Now we do a final carry propagation pass to normalize the result, which
    8781             :      * we combine with storing the result digits into the output. Note that
    8782             :      * this is still done at full precision w/guard digits.
    8783             :      */
    8784      827822 :     alloc_var(result, res_ndigits);
    8785      827822 :     res_digits = result->digits;
    8786      827822 :     carry = 0;
    8787    10237574 :     for (i = res_ndigits - 1; i >= 0; i--)
    8788             :     {
    8789     9409752 :         newdig = dig[i] + carry;
    8790     9409752 :         if (newdig >= NBASE)
    8791             :         {
    8792     1983020 :             carry = newdig / NBASE;
    8793     1983020 :             newdig -= carry * NBASE;
    8794             :         }
    8795             :         else
    8796     7426732 :             carry = 0;
    8797     9409752 :         res_digits[i] = newdig;
    8798             :     }
    8799      827822 :     Assert(carry == 0);
    8800             : 
    8801      827822 :     pfree(dig);
    8802             : 
    8803             :     /*
    8804             :      * Finally, round the result to the requested precision.
    8805             :      */
    8806      827822 :     result->weight = res_weight;
    8807      827822 :     result->sign = res_sign;
    8808             : 
    8809             :     /* Round to target rscale (and set result->dscale) */
    8810      827822 :     round_var(result, rscale);
    8811             : 
    8812             :     /* Strip leading and trailing zeroes */
    8813      827822 :     strip_var(result);
    8814             : }
    8815             : 
    8816             : 
    8817             : /*
    8818             :  * div_var() -
    8819             :  *
    8820             :  *  Division on variable level. Quotient of var1 / var2 is stored in result.
    8821             :  *  The quotient is figured to exactly rscale fractional digits.
    8822             :  *  If round is true, it is rounded at the rscale'th digit; if false, it
    8823             :  *  is truncated (towards zero) at that digit.
    8824             :  */
    8825             : static void
    8826      180162 : div_var(const NumericVar *var1, const NumericVar *var2, NumericVar *result,
    8827             :         int rscale, bool round)
    8828             : {
    8829             :     int         div_ndigits;
    8830             :     int         res_ndigits;
    8831             :     int         res_sign;
    8832             :     int         res_weight;
    8833             :     int         carry;
    8834             :     int         borrow;
    8835             :     int         divisor1;
    8836             :     int         divisor2;
    8837             :     NumericDigit *dividend;
    8838             :     NumericDigit *divisor;
    8839             :     NumericDigit *res_digits;
    8840             :     int         i;
    8841             :     int         j;
    8842             : 
    8843             :     /* copy these values into local vars for speed in inner loop */
    8844      180162 :     int         var1ndigits = var1->ndigits;
    8845      180162 :     int         var2ndigits = var2->ndigits;
    8846             : 
    8847             :     /*
    8848             :      * First of all division by zero check; we must not be handed an
    8849             :      * unnormalized divisor.
    8850             :      */
    8851      180162 :     if (var2ndigits == 0 || var2->digits[0] == 0)
    8852          56 :         ereport(ERROR,
    8853             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_DIVISION_BY_ZERO),
    8854             :                  errmsg("division by zero")));
    8855             : 
    8856             :     /*
    8857             :      * If the divisor has just one or two digits, delegate to div_var_int(),
    8858             :      * which uses fast short division.
    8859             :      *
    8860             :      * Similarly, on platforms with 128-bit integer support, delegate to
    8861             :      * div_var_int64() for divisors with three or four digits.
    8862             :      */
    8863      180106 :     if (var2ndigits <= 2)
    8864             :     {
    8865             :         int         idivisor;

    8867             :

    8880             :     }
    8881             : #ifdef HAVE_INT128
    8882        4758 :     if (var2ndigits <= 4)
